project.teaser: EuPRAXIA is the first European project that develops a dedicated particle accelerator research infrastructure based on novel plasma acceleration concepts and laser technology. It focuses on the development of electron accelerators and underlying technologies, their user...
project.objective:
EuPRAXIA is the first European project that develops a dedicated particle accelerator research infrastructure based on novel plasma acceleration concepts and laser technology. It focuses on the development of electron accelerators and underlying technologies, their user communities, and the exploitation of existing accelerator infrastructures in Europe. It was accepted onto the ESFRI roadmap for strategically important research infrastructures in June 2021 as a European priority.
To fully exploit the potential of this breakthrough facility, advances are urgently required in plasma and laser R&D, studies into facility design and optimization, along a coordinated push for novel applications. EuPRAXIA-DN is a new MSCA Doctoral Network for a cohort of 10 Fellows between universities, research centers and industry that will carry out an interdisciplinary and cross-sector plasma accelerator research and training program for this new research infrastructure. The network focuses on scientific and technical innovations and on boosting the career prospects of its Fellows.
project.title: EuPRAXIA Doctoral Network
project.keywords: plasma accelerators, medical applications, beam diagnostics, plasma physics, laser physics, sensors, light sources, X-ray imaging

article.title: Cross-sector plasma accelerator research and training programme

result.title: Journal articles
result.description: Research results will be published in research journals throughout the project lifetime, first results are expected from m24.

result.title: ‘Ionization Profile Monitor for In-Vivo Dosimetry in Medical Accelerators’

details.authors: M. Patel, N. Kumar, F. Thesni M.P and C. P. Welsch

result.title: Project initial brochure
result.description: Project initial brochure will be available online and in print, presenting the background of all Fellows and the overall research and training goals of the network.

result.title: Injector parameter space
result.description: Report, journal article or conference proceeding on results from simulation studies that demonstrate how parameter space to unlock pulse shaping and acceleration can be accessed.

result.title: Ultrashort pulse train generation
result.description: Report on results from theoretical/numerical studies into ultrashort pulse train generation using high power lasers. Optimum scheme has been identified (related milestone), findings will be summarized in report or journal paper.

result.title: Project web site
result.description: A website for the EuPRAXIA Doctoral Network will be available from the start of the project.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EuPRAXIA-DN (EuPRAXIA Doctoral Network)
result.teaser: EuPRAXIA is the first European project that develops a dedicated particle accelerator research infrastructure based on novel plasma acceleration concepts and laser technology. It focuses on the development of electron accelerators and underlying technologies, their user...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Multicycle THz generation
result.description: A code to simulate multicycle THz pulse generation has ben developed and results will be summarized in a technical report.

result.title: Project leaflet
result.description: A leaflet giving an overview of the network will be available online and in print.

result.title: Electron beam transport
result.description: A range of beam transport codes will be used for optimizing electron beam quality at the location of the undulator. A technical report on the results from this optimization will be published.

result.title: Development of an X-band LLRF prototype for the EuPRAXIA@SPARC_LAB LINAC

details.authors: A. Molodozhentsev, T. Green, B. Rus, A. Whitehead, S. Maity, P. Sasorov, A. Jancarek, M. Miceski, S. Niekrasz, P. Zimmermann

result.title: EuPRAXIA-DN outreach video
result.description: EuPRAXIA-DN outreach video will be available after first skills school which will be organized between ULIV and C-DIGI. It will be made available via YouTube.

result.title: Minimization of jitter
result.description: Minimization of jitter in SPARC_LAB working points through study of main jitter sources in photo-injector, including phase noise of accelerating fields, photo-cathode and interaction laser arrival time, together with impact on beam arrival time using established PIC codes.

result.title: Low power measurements
result.description: Journal paper on low power proof-of-concept measurements.

result.title: Laser beam diagnostics
result.description: Optimum set of diagnostics for the full characterization of the laser has been identified. System will be described in report or journal paper.

result.title: Conceptual Design of the laser-plasma accelerator based soft x-ray free electron laser

details.authors: A. Molodozhentsev, T. Green, B. Rus, A. Whitehead, S. Maity, P. Sasorov, A. Jancarek, M. Albrecht, M. Miceski, S. Niekrasz, P. Zimmermann

result.title: Intense multicycle THz generation
result.description: The generation of intense multicycle THz pulses has been demonstrated, initial results will be summarized in a technical report.

result.title: X-band Single-Channel LLRF prototype
result.description: A fundamental X-band LLRF concept with optimum components will have been developed and a protoype will have been designed. The design will be summarized in a technical report.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
